title: Speightstown Branch
description: In the midst of this once thriving trading town in St. Peter can be found the Speightstown Branch Library, one of the eight (8) branches of the National Library Service. Located on the first floor above the Post Office at the Republic Bank building, it is in close proximity to shopping and food centres. Courteous and welcoming staff, make for a very relaxing atmosphere. Services offered at this branch include access to EBSCO online database which contains e-books journals, newspapers and magazines, lending and reference services, Internet access, free Wi-fi and computer services, readers’ assistance and photocopying services. Every Saturday morning from 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. there is the children’s story-hour. Our regular hours are Monday to Friday 10:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., and Saturday 9 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.
